action.action-desc: Mr. Aguilar (for himself and Mr. Calvert) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Homeland Security

form.official-title: To provide for joint reports by relevant Federal agencies to Congress regarding incidents of terrorism, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Reporting Efficiently to Proper Officials in Response to Terrorism Act of 2017 or the REPORT Act.

subsection.text: Whenever an incident of terrorism occurs in the United States, it shall be the duty of the Secretary of Homeland Security, in coordination with the Attorney General, the Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, and, as appropriate, the head of the National Counterterrorism Center, to submit, not later than upon completion of the investigation by the primary Government agency conducting the investigation, an unclassified report (which may be accompanied by a classified annex) to Congress concerning that incident.
A report under this section shall containâ€”

paragraph.text: a statement of the facts of the incident, as known at the time of the report; and
any recommendations for changes in practices or law, consistent with the Constitution, with particular attention to changes that could help prevent future attacks.

subsection.text: In this section, the term incident of terrorism means an event declared by the Federal Bureau of Investigation to be an act of terrorism.
